columns.name: event_page_wiki
columns.comment: The Wiki ID the page is stored.

columns.name: event_page_prefixedtext
columns.comment: The full prefixedtext of the event page. This is needed for the crosswikiness, see T307358.

columns.name: event_chat_url
columns.comment: The link of the chat tool the organizers use to communicate.

columns.name: event_tracking_tool_id
columns.comment: The unique ID of the tracking tool the organizers use, as defined by the application.

columns.name: event_tracking_tool_event_id
columns.comment: The unique identifier of the event within the tracking tool.

columns.name: event_status
columns.comment: Status of the event. 1: Open. 2: Closed. 3: Draft. 4: Canceled.

columns.name: event_timezone
columns.comment: Timezone of the event, used with event_start_local and event_end_local.

columns.name: event_start_local
columns.comment: Start time of the event, in the local timezone (stored in event_timezone), in the TS_MW format. This does not use mwtimestamp because that is only intended for UTC time.

columns.name: event_start_utc
columns.comment: Start time of the event, in UTC. This value is derived from event_start_local, and is used for sorting.

columns.name: event_end_local
columns.comment: End time of the event, in the local timezone (stored in event_timezone), in the TS_MW format. This does not use mwtimestamp because that is only intended for UTC time.

columns.name: event_end_utc
columns.comment: End time of the event, in UTC. This value is derived from event_end_local, and is used for sorting.

columns.name: event_meeting_type
columns.comment: The type of the meeting. 1: In person. 2: Online. 3: Both

indexes.name: event_page
indexes.comment: Used when querying events by pages. The index is currently unique, but this may change in the future.

indexes.name: event_timezone_id
indexes.comment: Used when updating UTC timestamps, filtering by timezone and batching by primary key.

name: ce_participants
comment: Stores the participants of an event.

columns.name: cep_event_id
columns.comment: Gets the event id from campaign_events table.

columns.name: cep_user_id
columns.comment: The Central ID.

columns.name: cep_private
columns.comment: Whether the user registered privately for the event.

indexes.name: cep_event_participant
indexes.comment: Uniqueness constraint, used in queries where we need the event first.

name: ce_organizers
comment: Stores the organizers of an event.

columns.name: ceo_event_id
columns.comment: Gets the event id from campaign_events table.

columns.name: ceo_user_id
columns.comment: The Central ID.

columns.name: ceo_roles
columns.comment: Bit set of the roles that the organizer has for a specific event.

columns.name: ceo_created_at
columns.comment: Timestamp of when the user first became an organizer.

columns.name: ceo_deleted_at
columns.comment: Timestamp of when the user stopped being an organizer.

indexes.name: ceo_event_user
indexes.comment: Uniqueness constraint, used when retrieving the organizers of an event.

columns.name: cea_full_address
columns.comment: Full address of the event.

columns.name: cea_country
columns.comment: Event country.

name: ce_event_address
comment: Stores the id of the event and the id of an address.

columns.name: ceea_event
columns.comment: The id of the event on campaign_events.

columns.name: ceea_address
columns.comment: The id of the address on ce_address.
